title: A Snapshot Of The Spike In Inequality, As Seen From Dayton
teaser: A new report released by the U.S. Conference of Mayors has found that jobs gained since the recession pay dramatically less than the jobs lost during the recession. To comment on the findings, Nan Whaley, mayor of Dayton, Ohio, speaks with Melissa Block.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
